CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier, July 1, 1961, pg. 1 reads: "Last Ride for 'Clarkie' - Pallbearers place the casket, bearing the remains of John L. Clark, veteran Pittsburgh Courier reporter and author of the celebrated column, "Wylie Avenue," into the hearse for "Clarkie's" last ride down his beloved "beat," Tuesday afternoon. He died Friday, in his home.  Pallbearers were: Voyle Parker, Frank E. Bolden, William G. Nunn, Wilbert Holloway, William Harris, Herbert Smith and Lester Hood.  Members of the 351st Field Artillery, in which the deceased served overseas in World War I, were in attendance at the rites. He worked 37 years at The Courier. - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Pallbearers Voyle Parker, Frank E. Bolden, William G. Nunn, Wilbert Holloway, William Harris, Herbert Smith, and Lester Hood, loading casket of John L. Clark draped with American flag into hearse parked on belgian block street, with group of men and women gathered behind
